## Plot a plane

```{r plotlyPlane3d}
# ********************************************************************************
# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70699740/
this_res <- 2
x <- seq(from=0, to=8, by=this_res)
y <- seq(from=0, to=8, by=this_res)
z1 <- x+y #For the first plane

points <- tibble(x = x, y = y, z = z1)
# prepare all combination of x and y, and calculate z
xyz <- tidyr::crossing(x, y) %>%
  mutate(z = x+y)

plot_ly(x = ~x, y = ~y, z = ~z, type = "mesh3d", data = xyz) %>% 
  add_markers(~ x, ~y, ~z, data = points)

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
